critique: The document is an executive order focused on promoting clean and efficient vehicles in the United States. It sets a goal for 50% of new passenger cars and light trucks sold in 2030 to be zero-emission vehicles and directs the EPA and Department of Transportation to establish new emissions and fuel economy standards. The order emphasizes boosting domestic jobs, improving the economy and public health, energy security, consumer savings, environmental justice, and addressing the climate crisis. It also calls for coordination with various stakeholders, including labor unions, states, industry, and environmental justice organizations.
